alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 5:20PM EDT until August 19 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Southeastern Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Surfside Beach, Pawleys Island, Murrells Inlet, Garden City, Socastee, Springmaid Pier, Myrtle Beach Airport, Winyah Bay Entrance, Yawkey South Island, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Litchfield Beach, Burgess, Forestbrook, North Santee, Hand and Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
